oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Seventeenth Street Christian Church, 2001 December
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of the Seventeenth Street Christian Church. This church was located at 1700 Fatherland Street in East Nashville. The foundation material is rough cut stone blocks. Exterior walls are red brick. The roof is comprised of tar shingles, both gabled and hipped. Windows are tall and rectangular, and made of colored glass. A two-story, red brick addition was completed in 1951. The denomination of the congregation was Christian. In 2006 the building was sold and has since been torn down. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Seventeenth Street Christian Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
